title: 107_s1905
content:
The Act includes a table of contents outlining sections related to veterans' health-care improvements, veterans' benefit programs, and VA program administration improvements. Title I of the Act focuses on veterans' health-care improvements, including provisions such as care for newborn children of enrolled women veterans and amendments related to the senior executive service in the VA. Title I of the Act introduces improvements in veterans' healthcare, including care for newborn children of enrolled women veterans and outpatient dental care for all former prisoners of war. Title II of the Act addresses veterans' benefit programs, including limitations on the provision of certain benefits. Title II of the Act limits the provision of certain benefits for deceased veterans, including certificates, flags, headstones, and markers. These limitations apply to deaths occurring on or after the enactment date. SEC. 202 clarifies procedures for disqualifying individuals for burial in veterans cemeteries. SEC. 203 clarifies the period for appealing decisions of the Board of Veterans Appeals. These amendments apply to decisions made after the enactment of the Act. TITLE III--VA PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION IMPROVEMENTS

SEC. 301. REPEAL OF CAP ON NON-CAREER SENIOR EXECUTIVE SERVICE MEMBERS IN VA.

SEC. 302. REPEAL OF PRECEDING-SERVICE REQUIREMENT FOR VA DEPUTY ASSISTANT SECRETARIES.

SEC. 303. REVOLVING SUPPLY FUND AMENDMENTS.

SEC. 304. REDEFINITION OF "MINORITY GROUP MEMBER" IN 38 U.S.C. Sec. 544(D). SEC. 304 amends the definition of "minority group member" in 38 U.S.C. Sec. 544(D) to include specific racial and ethnic groups.
